entry.para: Installer, Transmission Extension Housing Fluid Seal

calloutgroup.callout1: Bolt - M8 x 70 hex flange head
Bolts - M8 x 1.25 x 45 - front pump
Race and bearing assembly - sun gear thrust No. 2B and 3B
Plates - overdrive clutch internal spline - friction
Plates - overdrive clutch external spline - steel
Ring - overdrive clutch press plate retaining
Cylinder and bushing assembly - coast clutch
Plates - coast clutch internal spline - friction (model dependent)
Plates - coast clutch external spline - steel (model dependent)
Bearing and race assembly - direct clutch No. 4B
Bearing and race assembly - sun gear thrust No. 5B
Bolt - M12 x 1.75 x 31 hex flange head (intermediate clutch feed)
Bolt - M12 x 1.75 x 31 Torx® head (forward clutch feed)
Support and spring assembly - intermediate clutch
Cylinder and hub assembly - direct clutch
Ring - direct clutch balance piston retaining
Plates - direct clutch internal spline - friction
Plates - direct clutch external spline - steel
Ring - direct clutch plate retaining (selective fit)
Ring - forward clutch balance piston retaining
Plates - forward clutch internal spline - friction
Plates - forward clutch external spline - steel
Ring - forward clutch plate retaining (selective fit)
Washer - forward clutch hub thrust No. 9T
Bearing and race assembly - sun gear thrust No. 10B, 12B, 15B
Hub and bushing assembly - forward ring gear
Bearing and race assembly - forward carrier No. 11B
Ring - reverse clutch pressure plate - retaining
Plates - reverse clutch internal spline - friction
Plates - reverse clutch external spline - steel
Retainer and spring assembly - reverse clutch
Bearing assembly - parking gear needle thrust (slip yoke) No. 17B
Stud - M6 x 1 1-M10 x 1.563 extension housing
Bolts - M10 x 1.5 x 93.5 extension housing
Bolts - M10 x 1.5 x 40 extension housing
Washer - parking gear thrust fixed yoke No. 17 T
Bolt - M10 1.5 x 24 hex flange head
Screw and washer - M8 x 1.25 x 23.5 hex (2 required)
Screw - M8 x 1.25 x 25 pan head
Bolts - M6 x 1.0 x 15.2 hex flange head transmission range
Roll pin - manual control lever to case
Bolt - M6 x 1 x 30 hex head (5 required)
Bolt - M6 x 15.2 solenoid backing plate-to-ditch plate (5 required)
Bolt - M6 x 27.5 solenoid manifold-to-ditch plate (3 required)
Bolt - M6 x 1.0 x 42.5 hex flange head (3 required)
Bolt - M6 x 55 solenoid manifold-to-ditch plate (1 required)
Bolt - M6 x 68 hex flange (13 required)
Bolt - T25 holds wire harness to manifold (2 required)

note.para: Soak all friction clutch plates in clean automatic transmission fluid.
Prior to installation, lightly lubricate all O-ring seals with clean automatic transmission fluid.
Lightly lubricate all thrust washers with clean automatic transmission fluid to hold them in place during assembly.

step1.para: Mount the transmission case into a suitable stand.
If removed, use the special tool to install the short fluid inlet tube.
If removed, use the special tool to install a new Teflon® seal retainer.
• Install 2 new Teflon® seals.

note.para: Coat the reverse clutch piston seals with clean automatic transmission fluid.

step1.para: Install the reverse clutch piston in the case until it is fully seated in the case.
Install the reverse clutch return spring assembly.

warning.para: Do not over compress the return spring or damage to the spring will occur.

step1.para: Using the special tools, install the reverse clutch return spring snap ring.

note.para: Use clean automatic transmission fluid to hold the No. 17 thrust bearing or washer in place during assembly.

step1.para: Install the No. 17 park gear thrust bearing.

warning.para: Be careful when installing the output shaft not to damage the seals or a transmission leak could occur.

step1.para: Install the output shaft.

caution.para: The Torx® screw has a threadlocking compound. If the screw is removed, it must be discarded and a new screw installed.

step1.para: If removed, install the parking pawl abutment with a new Torx® screw.
• Tighten to 24 Nm (18 lb-ft).
Install the parking pawl.

calloutgroup.callout1: Install the parking pawl return spring.

note.para: Make sure the dimple on the parking guide support plate is facing inward.

step1.para: Install the parking rod guide plate.

calloutgroup.callout1: Install the parking rod guide plate.

step1.para: Install a new orifice lube plug in the rear of the case. Using a 12 mm (0.47 inch) socket, tap the orifice lube plug into the back of the transmission. Check to make sure that the orifice lube plug is fully seated into the back of the transmission.
Install a new extension housing gasket.
Install the extension housing.
• Tighten to 47 Nm (35 lb-ft).
Using the special tool, install a new manual control lever seal.
Install the transmission range sensor, park rod assembly and loosely install the bolts.
Install the manual control lever.
Install the roll pin into the case.
Install a new roll pin. Leave 2 mm (0.08 in) of the pin exposed.
Tighten the TR sensor bolts.
• Tighten to 10 Nm (89 lb-in).
Using the special tool, install a new extension housing seal.
Inspect the new output shaft nut O-ring for cuts. A new nut must be installed.
Using the special tool, install the output shaft nut.
• Tighten to 200 Nm (148 lb-ft).
Install the output shaft flange and a new bolt.
• Tighten to 135 Nm (100 lb-ft).
Install the No. 16 bearing and race.
Install the ring gear, hub and the No. 15 hub bearing.
Install the reverse carrier and hub assembly.
Install the low/reverse clutch plates.

item.para: Start with a steel plate on the bottom, followed by a friction plate.
Alternately stack the remaining steel and friction plates.
Add the pressure plate (low/reverse one-way clutch) on the last friction plate, with "THIS SIDE UP" facing upward.

caution.para: Do not apply air pressure to move the low/reverse piston without first installing the friction plates and the snap ring, or damage to the snap ring will occur.

step1.para: Install the new snap ring. Make sure the snap ring opening is in the 1 o'clock position between 2 teeth on the case.
• Check the function of the reverse clutch by applying air to the correct passage (through the case valve body worm trail) for the reverse clutch.
Using the special tools, install the forward geartrain as an assembly.
Install the intermediate clutch pressure plate.
• Position the intermediate clutch pressure plate in the case with the 3 tabs facing downward.
Install the intermediate clutch plates, starting with a friction plate.
Install the center support.
Loosely install the feed bolts.

calloutgroup.callout1: Loosely install the Torx® head forward clutch feed bolt into the case toward the rear of the case.
Loosely install the hex head intermediate clutch feed bolt into the case toward the front of the case.

step1.para: Using the special tool, install the center support snap ring.
• The snap ring should be installed with the flat edge facing downward. The gap in the snap ring should be facing in the 6 o'clock position. Tap the snap ring securely into the case.
Tighten the feed bolts.
• Tighten to 32 Nm (24 lb-ft).
Install the No. 5 thrust bearing onto the center support.
Install the center shaft and ring gear.
Install the No. 4 thrust bearing onto the center shaft.
Using the special tool, install the coast clutch assembly and overdrive carrier.
Install the overdrive clutch assembly snap ring with the gap in the 6 o'clock position.
Install the overdrive pressure plate with the notches facing up.
Install the overdrive clutch.
Install a new pump gasket.
Install the No. 2 thrust bearing.
Install the input shaft into the case.

note.para: Alignment pins are used in case holes located at the 5 o'clock and 11 o'clock positions.

step1.para: Install the special tools into the case in order to install the pump.
Check to make sure that the No. 1 thrust washer is installed on the pump stator.

note.para: Pump-to-case alignment pins are used in case holes located at the 11 o'clock and 5 o'clock positions.

step1.para: Using the special tools, install the pump assembly.
Install new retaining bolts.
• Tighten to 27 Nm (20 lb-ft).
Install a new main control body gasket.
Using the special tools, check the function of each clutch. Apply 20 psi (137.9 kPa) of air to each port.
Using the special tools, install the solenoid body and loosely install the bolts.
• While installing the solenoid body, align the manual valve.
Tighten all the bolts in the sequence shown.
• Tighten to 13 Nm (10 lb-ft).
Connect the TR sensor connector.

note.para: Prior to installing the fluid filter, make sure that the old seal is not stuck in the case.

step1.para: Install a new transmission fluid filter.

note.para: Reuse the fluid pan gasket unless it is damaged.

step1.para: Install the transmission fluid pan gasket to the fluid pan. Make sure the magnet is positioned over the dimple in the fluid pan.

note.para: Tighten all the transmission fluid pan bolts in a crisscross pattern.

step1.para: Install the fluid pan gasket and fluid pan.
• Tighten to 15 Nm (11 lb-ft).
Install the intermediate shaft and turbine shaft combination speed sensor.

calloutgroup.callout1: Lubricate the O-ring seal with clean automatic transmission fluid and install the intermediate shaft and turbine shaft combination speed sensor.
Install the bolt. Tighten to 9 Nm (80 lb-in).

step1.para: Install the output shaft speed (OSS) sensor.

calloutgroup.callout1: Lubricate the O-ring seal with clean automatic transmission fluid and install the OSS sensor.
Install the bolt. Tighten to 9 Nm (80 lb-in).

caution.para: Do not damage the fluid pump gear O-ring when installing the torque converter.
Make sure the converter hub is fully engaged in the front pump support and gear and rotates freely. Do not damage the hub seal.
If the torque converter slides out, the hub seal may be damaged.

step1.para: Lubricate the converter hub with clean automatic transmission fluid.

caution.para: Use care when installing the torque converter to avoid damage to the front pump stator support seal.

note.para: Check the converter crankshaft pilot for nicks or damaged surfaces that can cause interference when installing the transmission to the engine. Check the converter impeller hub for nicks or sharp edges that can damage the pump seal.

step1.para: Using the special tools, install the torque converter. Push and rotate the converter onto the front pump assembly until it bottoms out.
Check the seating of the torque converter.

calloutgroup.callout1: Place the straightedge across the converter housing.
Make sure there is a gap between the converter pilot face and the straightedge.

step1.para: Use the special tool to hold the torque converter in place when installing the transmission.
